term.title: spectator mechanism

item.text: A pre-association mechanism in which one of the molecular entities, C, is already present in an encounter pair with A during formation of B from A, but does not assist the formation of B, e.g. [image: Not defined] The formation of B from A may itself be a bimolecular reaction with some other reagent. Since C does not assist the formation of A, it is described as being present as a spectator, and hence such a mechanism is sometimes referred to as a spectator mechanism.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 1077. 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 1165 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466051077)
